headline: White Chocolate Macadamia Nut Cookies
description: These white chocolate macadamia nut cookies are golden and chewy and studded with chocolate ‚Äî a combination of comfort and luxury that's sure to please.

video.description: See how to make an amazing cookie with nuts and white chocolate.
video.name: White Chocolate Macadamia Nut Cookies III

name: White Chocolate Macadamia Nut Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Cream butter, brown sugar, and white sugar together in a large bowl until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla and almond extracts.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in another bowl. Gradually stir the dry ingredients into the butter mixture. Fold in macadamia nuts and white chocolate.
Drop dough by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: It was good but can improve....
By far the best cookie recipe I have done! It was a hit at home. My family keeps asking for me to make them!

So! I decided I wanted to make cookies for my boyfriend's family meeting them for the first time and he chose the type of cookie they'd like. I'd never made white chocolate macadamia nut cookies but I've made most other types and I'm the kind of baker who usually plays fast and loose with recipes. I read the mixed reviews and here's my tips/changes: 1. Equal parts brown and white sugar, I did 3/4 cup of both. 2. Cream the sugar and butter until it's fluffy and fully incorporate the eggs, it shouldn't look grainy or separated. 3. I used double vanilla purely because I hate almond extract and it's not a normal flavoring for these cookies. It'd be a good addition if you're a fan of marzipan flavor. 4. I used salted butter but unsalted nuts then the called for 1/2 tsp salt. 5. I cooked them 6 at a time on a medium non stick pan and that helped them spread and crisp the bottom/edges. 6. Mix it by hand, beat the hell out of the wet ingredients but as soon as you add flour all you should be doing is incorporating it, I did about 15 turns with a wooden spoon, then another 10 for mixing in the nuts and I used white chips. They turned out amazing with minor adjustments and I'm at high altitude. (about 7000ft)
Followed recipe and cookies came out great!
I was disappointed. I wanted cookies and these did not flatten. I followed the recipe exactly and these were too cakey. I will be looking for a better recipe.
Excellent - cookies maintained the chewy texture over the three days they lasted. I did add 1/4 cup of flour to the mix to make it a bit more firm. My hubby did they were awesome!
Just what you want a white chocolate macadamia nut cookie to taste like. One batch makes a little over four dozen when using a 2 tsp scoop.

Second time making. I had to substitute 1/2 portion coconut oil for the butter (which also entailed cooking for a few minutes longer), but they were even better for it. I only use 1/2 the white sugar and find them plenty tasty.
My family loved them.
Good cookies.
Very confused about the Reviews. These were some of the best cookies I‚Äôve ever had an a long time. I didn‚Äôt make any changes to the recipe and they were very flavorful.

These cookies a very cakey. If you're looking for more of a light cookie with caramelized edges this isn't it. There wasn't much flavor other than too sweet. I wasted my time and ingredients making them.
I didn‚Äôt have any almond extract so I only used vanilla and they turned out pretty good! I also used the entire bag of white chocolate chips‚Ä¶ because, why not?!

I love this recipe. I've used it before. It's easy and tastes great. I make these on a regular for my granddaughter. I've been making these cookies using this recipe for years. These a my granddaughters favorite cookie.
I think the cookies were pretty good.
Absolutely delicious
I added coconut flakes...came out well...not too sweet!!!
A cookie connoisseur here, one of the best recipes that I've tried. Nothing at all needs to be altered. Soft, chewy, edges a little crunchy, just delicious.

I made this exactly as it was written (minus the almond extract because I‚Äôm not a fan) and it turned out perfectly!! White choc mac nut cookies are my fave and I will make this again and again. My whole family loved it too!

I made a half batch as written (only omitted the salt since I used salted nuts.) They tasted good, but as other reviewers said - TOO MUCH ALMOND EXTRACT! I could tell it was going to be too much as soon as I added it. I‚Äôd cut it in half and add a little more vanilla instead!

It was so good! They came out soft and amazing! Instead of adding nuts I added banana with the white chocolate chips and it turned out amazing! The banana was soft and creamy and the chocolate chips were melted and added extra flavor. I definitely recommend this recipe!

made these for my husband's birthday and they turned out great! I actually made larger dough balls with the hopes that they'd flatten out to the big chewy cookies sold at cafes, etc. They took 12-13 minutes to bake and didn't flatten, but were perfectly chewy! Next time, I'll flatten down the dough balls when baking. I also sprinkled flaky salt on top before baking, which accentuated the flavors! Will definitely make again!
loved them
Recipe was perfect I used green food dye for the St. Patrick's Day festive feel üçÄ. They came out to be the exact green I wanted so happy üòä. Happy St. Patties Day Everyone!
Very easy and delicious

I used white chocolate chips instead of chunk white chocolate, because I had them on hand. And I didn‚Äôt have any almond extract, and so doubled the vanilla. They were very good, but I think that I will try making them again, using the almond extract, and a less-sweet white chocolate.

These are okay. I think they're a little too fluffy for this type of cookie. I might try this again, but without the baking soda so that the cookie is more solid. I think the flavor is good, but mild. I might cut back on the flour, too, just a bit. Maybe add an egg.

Made it gluten free by substituting a GF flour mix with xanthan gum and it came out really well. I'd really missed the taste of the Pepperidge Farm White Chocolate Macadamia Nut cookies and this hit the spot! Maybe better because PF Cookies aren't hot out of the oven!
I like the recipe. I doubled the recipe. I changed the flour mixture to 4 cups all-purpose flour, 1 cup of Hershey's baking cocoa. I did a rough chop, roasted the macadamia nuts.

I was not happy with the results. I used half butter and half butter flavored crisco, and also doubled the vanilla extract and omitted the almond extract as some other reviews suggested. The cookies did not spread hardly at all, were very cakey, and not sweet enough. I had previously made the Betty Crocker White Chip Macadamia Nut cookie mix, and it was a very superior cookie.

I also followed the recipe exactly as is and found that the cookies were almost perfect. I am not sure if my oven isn't as hot but I found that baking the cookies between 12 - 14 mins turned out better. At 12 mins, you get the crisp, caramelized edges with the soft inside. I personally love my cookies on the burnt side a little so at 14 mins gives me a more crunchy cookie with the subtle burnt-sugar flavour. 

I can never get my cookies to look pretty like store bought cookies by using the drop-method so I just refrigerated the dough for a bit until it was firmer, molded the dough into balls, and then press down on that ball a little bit.

Made these as written. Baking time was spot-on, only rotated the tray at the halfway point. I think I would increase the salt by at least 1/4 tsp and I'm not sure the almond extract adds the flavor profile I want. The cookies are certainly okay and very edible, but I wouldn't call them stellar.

After reading the reviews on this recipe, I was quite hesitant. I kept jotting down the adjustments people made. For example less flour, no almond extract, one less egg, etc. I finally decided to make the recipe as is and then if I wanted to, to make adjustments after that. I‚Äôm glad I did not make one change. I‚Äôm not sure what others were talking about as far as the cookie turning out like cake. Even though they come out puffy, once they sat for a few minutes they rested and came out chewy. Glad I made them. Would not change a thing. Thank you for the recipe.

To make this Keto/ Diabetic Friendly. Substitute:-Flour for Keto Flour Blend ‚ÄúNature seats The Ultimate Nut Flour 1:1.Both Sugars for Monk Fruit granulated:1 cup; powdered: 1/4 cup; Monk Fruit Maple Styrup: 1/4 cup.-‚ÄúLily‚Äôs No Sugar White Chocolate Chips‚Äù-Use 1 Teasp Vanilla & 1/4 Teasp Almond extract instead-Use 3/4 Teasp Baking Powder-Use 1 Teasp Baking Soda-Add 1 extra EggBlend sugar, eggs, syrup, extracts until frothy add room temp butter until slightly chunky.Add in dry ingredients.Scoop into cookie sheet and press
Uh these don‚Äôt need almond extract! To overpowering I followed the recipe exactly and I‚Äôm not happy with these. not happy with this recipe at all.
I love this recipe. Living at 8500 feet I added an extra 1/4 cup flour and 2 tsp water. I bake them for 14 min. The almond really enhances the macadamia flavor

Very delicious. I have always used 1/2 butter and 1/2 Crisco for cookies. Learned that the hard way about 20+ years ago. I use my convection function on my oven. They turned out perfect texture wise this way. I will definitely be making these again and again.
Really disappointing. First attempt came out a goopy mess. Second attempt, doubled the flour, still goopy. I suppose it tastes fine, just not really my cup of tea.
These cookies are great I have made them both as regular cookies and as a cookie cake using a pizza tray and they taste great both ways

I had to soften my butter and accidentally melted about half of it (used it anyways)... I put double the almond extract and I also baked them for only 9 min and left them on the pan for 2 min... These cookies are the most perfect I have ever had. Everyone agrees too! HIGHLY recommend this recipe to EVERYONE! I might alter it and use it for chocolate chip cookies as well
used the recipe exactly as written and they were amazing I've made these 5 or 6 times

Used this recipe and Iv got to say its the best tasting cookies and were approved by my 3 children. And my kiddos dont really like White Chocolate Macadamia Nut cookies. I followed the advise of 1/2 shortening and 1/2 butter and they were just somewhat crunchy enough on outside and perfect in the inside. Just delicious. Will continue to use this recipe. Thanj you for sharing.
This recipe is awful. I tried it twice total waste. Cookies are so flat you can‚Äôt even get them off the pan. Not even a cookie, won‚Äôt ever be trying again.
These were awful! Lesson learned to read the reviews before I try the recipe. I‚Äôve never had something turn out so bad!! Cookies did not form at all. One big mess on the pan. Waste of ingredients

ok, I made these for our Monday night family get together. My wife and I have always done dinner for the kids and grandkids on Monday nights. I only changed the amount of vanilla extract to 3/4 tsp and 1/4 tsp of Almond extract. Was a major hit!!!
total waste of supplies. bland is for meals at a hospital.

This is the first time I have ever been disappointed in a cookie recipe. I made exactly as the recipe is written except I did have to bake for 12 minutes and they were flavorless and not sweet at all. I will not make again.
I followed the instructions exactly and the cookies came out perfect. We loved the hint of almond in them along with the white chocolate. I will definitely be making these cookies again and again.

I skipped the almond extract, but added one cup of shredded sweetened coconut and one teaspoon of coconut extract. I also left the macadamia nuts and white chocolate chips whole. If you like coconut then you might want to try. I doubled the recipe and they went fast!
Very delicious! These cookies turned out just right. I've also made them with a litte cinnamon and they turn out wonderful!
It was delicious! We made giant cookies that were as big as your head!
These were so delicious. They are the best cookie ever. I didn‚Äôt have almond extract so I doubled the vanilla, otherwise followed the recipe as written.
It has easy to read instructions, and the outcome was fantastic! A wonderful quarantine snack/desert!
They turned out great and delicious. It was just as easy to make the recipe directed

I love this recipe! This was the first time I tried making white chocolate macadamia cookies and they came out so well! I did add some extra almond flavoring because I prefer a nuttier flavor, other than that they were perfect.

PROS: 
* Extremely simple recipe
* Nice texture

CONS:
* Not very flexible shapewise - if you use a cookie scooper, you might end up with big, tall cookies with a lot of air
* The almond extract is a bit too much, makes the whole thing taste a bit like an almond cookie
* Flavor is quite bland generally, needs more salt or sugar

Overall a decent recipe, but needs to be tweaked more.
Good cookie recipe. Will make again
Recipe is no good. Cookie came out on the cake side, tasteless no flavor nothing. Seems like all the ingredients were written half of tge true amount.
I used a good quality white chocolate chip and these came out wonderful! I love them and so does my hubby. Thanks for sharing!
Delicious and easy.
I made exactly as recipe indicated. Too cakey and I didn‚Äôt like the almond extract.
It is a very good cookie indeed, but not quite as good as the big ones you get at Port of Subs. I followed recipe to the exact and I am a decent baker for sure.
I have made these several times and I‚Äôm in love!! Definitely recommend
Followed the recipe completely and they came out really puffy and cake like. They were good but not what i was looking for. :(
These are great! Recommend!!

YUMMY! I read a ton of reviews before baking these gems. First, I used all vegan butter because of lactose intolerance, and because I don‚Äôt like cooking with shortening. I also used all vanilla and no almond extract. They are crunchy on the outside and chewy and tasty on the inside. I also kept the cookie dough in the fridge between batches to stay chilled. I think this helped with spreading. I used an medium pampered chef cookie scooper and cooked for 10 minutes on 350.

First batch i put it in for 8 minutes and the bottoms burned pretty badly. Second batch i put parchment paper underneath the dough and cooked for 9 minutes and they were perfectly cooked. Be careful though, very easy to overcook. maybe less white chocolate/macadamia nuts next time since there were a lot and i found it overbearing (probs 3/4 cup of each would b better)
Delicious as written.
I halved the recipe for just a few cookies. Worked out and tasted great!
They didn't expand like normal cookies do. They just look like a lump and I followed the recipe completely so I don't know what went wrong
Recipe was well written easy to follow. The cookies were well received. I would use this recipe again.

I followed directions exactly and the cookies came out perfect. I used all salted butter, no shortening. My cookies were puffy and lightly crisp on the bottom, moist inside. I wish I would of used a better quality white chocolate; I used white baking chips from Aldi and I‚Äôm not impressed, they were bland and waxy. I baked the cookies for 10 minutes, they came out perfect, no spreading at all. Also would use more macadamia nuts, I only had 1/2 cup on hand. Definitely will make again and again!

Recipe followed as written except for the deletion of the almond extract as I was out of it. Results were perfect, buttery, slightly chewy deliciousness. For those having problems with taste and texture, be sure to use real butter, not margarine and ensure the oven is preheated. Too much spreading could.be the result of expired baking powder, or dough that is too warm. Adding this to my favorites!
Delicious!
Best white chocolate macadamia nut cookies I have ever had!

Would definitely make again! I made as directed, but with 1 tsp vanilla (no almond extract). I put the trays of dough in the fridge while I pre-heated the oven to avoid excess spreading. I had two trays in the oven at the same time, the top batch came out good and doughy, the bottom batch came out more round with crispy bottoms. I used an ice cream scoop, which yielded 20 cookies, and took about 14 min in the oven.

Good cookie. I personally am not fond of them, but they‚Äôre my husband‚Äôs favorite. I probably make them at least once a month. A double recipe only lasts a few days I use only 1/4 cup of white sugar per my hubby‚Äôs request and he is a sweet stuff junky. Never had a problem with spreading . Have used butter as well as shortening. My recipe does not call for almond extract, just vanilla. Otherwise recipes are identical.
Very tasty cookie! A bit on the cakey side, but that‚Äôs ok, too! Next time, I‚Äôll leave out one egg and add a touch of cinnamon because that‚Äôs what my taste buds call for.

These are great. Made exactly as written and they did not spread as others mentioned. If they are spreading your butter is too soft. I only left mine out for about 20 minutes at tooYou can fix this/ensure they won‚Äôt spread by chilling your dough before baking.
Terrible , didn‚Äôt grow up to cookies like this

I made it exactly as stated as that's the only fair way to rate it. I found them bland. I use great quality ingredients but they were truely tasteless unless you got a bite of nut and chocolate at the same time. It needed more almond, or even almond flour and more nuts and chocolate.
My daughter made this, and the 1st batch, they came out flat. The 2nd time, we split equal parts baking soda and baking powder and they came out great.
Added whole bag of white chocolate chips and heaping cup of chopped salted marcona almonds! Loved the cookie!

It was really good! Soft chewy cookie. I prefer more crunch. Will try to play with the recipe a bit.
But flavorful for sure!!! Thank you!!!

Wow! I made these today and they were outstanding! As with any cookie, you need to cream the butter and sugars really well before adding any other ingredients - this helps the sugars dissolves into the butter. I scraped down the bowl several times to ensure all sugar was incorporated. When I added the eggs, I also scraped the bowl and mixed well before adding the next egg. We like our cookies slightly underbaked, as the carry-over will occur on the cookie sheet when you remove them from the oven. This cookie is the perfect bite! Not too much white chocolate (I hate that stuff!!) and just the right amount of macadamia nuts. Delicious!
Made exact to recipe, FANTASTIC cookie! This is my 2nd time making. Thanks for sharing your recipe.
yummy
Love this recipe. Best white chocolate macadamia nut cookies ever. I did double the vanilla extract and almond extract. I did a full teaspoon for both.
These turn out amazing every time!! Like Mrs. Fields at home! I used the recipe as is and have never had any issues!
Truly amazing the best ever

I am not sure if I did something wrong but I could not get the cookies to spread out like I am used to. They ended up with a very cakey texture/somewhat dry. I want to try them again with the suggest shortening instead of just butter alone.
These were so so delicious!!

soooo good! me and my family loved it! it's so crispy but soft at the same time. So it's a perfect cookie. I think that everyone should try this recipe at least once but they are totally going to be making these cookies again after the first time, I know I will! 

(p.s. I am right now!)

Cooking time and recipe is WAY off made it twice to give it a fair chance and both times they burnt the bottom long before the tops were cooked - even spread out I tried a couple different approaches and nope burnt 
Cant believe this is one of the best rated recipes
Followed instructions and cookies came out great! saving recipe to make again and again.
Made these cookies exactly (used one bag of white cc) as the recipe is written and they turned out great!!

I made these cookies last night & they turned out perfect! I only made 1 substitution (and only because I had no almond extract on hand). I substituted rum extract for the almond extract. On a side note, these would probably be good with a little shredded coconut added in also!
Came out a little too puffy, but they were delicious!
I omitted the salt because I was using salted butter and they were delicious.
